name: Gold & Silver
intro: Zakat on gold and silver is obligatory for anyone who owns these metals above the nisab for a full lunar year. It ensures wealth is purified and benefits those in need.

evidences.text: And those who hoard gold and silver and spend it not in the way of Allah... give them tidings of a painful punishment.
Zakat expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy...
No zakat is due on less than five awsuq of dates, nor less than five camels, nor less than five uqiyah of silver.

conditions: Owns gold or silver above the nisab (85g gold, 595g silver) for one lunar year (hawl).
Metals are fully owned and accessible.
calculation: Weigh your gold and silver. If the total is above the nisab, pay 2.5% of the market value.
example: Example: You own 100g of gold. The nisab is 85g. You pay 2.5% of the value of 100g.
madhhabNotes: Hanafi: Zakat on all gold, including jewelry.
Maliki/Shafi'i: No zakat on personal jewelry.
Hanbali: Precaution is to pay zakat on jewelry.

faq.q: Is zakat due on gold jewelry?
faq.a: Hanafi: Yes. Others: Not if for personal use. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/19901/zakaah-on-jewellery

faq.q: What is the nisab for gold?
Is zakat due on silver jewelry?
How do I calculate the value?
faq.a: Use current market price for gold/silver. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/2795/nisab-of-zakaah-in-grams-of-gold-and-silver
